title: Alphabet
content:
Alphabet 

 Contains utilities for working with alphabets.
 
Alphabet.ofLetters 
ofLetters 
Alphabet.makeOrRaise 
makeOrRaise 
Alphabet.makeNanoId 
makeNanoId 
Alphabet.parseNanoId 
parseNanoId

title: Alphabet.ofLetters
content:
Alphabet.ofLetters ofLetters Builds a new Alphabet from the given letter set after checking that it upholds certain invariants which are necessary for the algorithm to work well. An alphabet's letters MUST uphold the following invariants:
  • Is not null
  • Contains at least one (1) non-whitespace letter
  • Contains no more then 255 letters

title: Alphabet.makeOrRaise
content:
Alphabet.makeOrRaise makeOrRaise Builds a new Alphabet from the given letter set after checking that it upholds certain invariants which are necessary for the algorithm to work well. An alphabet's letters MUST uphold the following invariants:
  • Is not null
  • Contains at least one (1) non-whitespace letter
  • Contains no more then 255 letters

title: Alphabet.makeNanoId
content: Alphabet.makeNanoId makeNanoId Creates a new NanoId instance of the given size whose letters are taken from the given alphabet.

title: Alphabet.parseNanoId
content: Alphabet.parseNanoId parseNanoId Attempts to convert the given value into a NanoId, using a valid alphabet to guide validation.

title: Core
content:
Core 

 Contains simple functions for generating 'nano identifier' strings
 (a simple alternative to things like 'Universal Unique Identifiers').
  
Core.Alphabets 
Alphabets 
Core.Defaults 
Defaults 
Core.Tagged 
Tagged 
Core.nanoIdOf 
nanoIdOf 
Core.nanoId 
nanoId

title: Core.nanoIdOf
content: Core.nanoIdOf nanoIdOf Generates a new identifier, size characters in length, derived from the letters of the given alphabet (note: a size of less than one will result in an empty string). When viewed from other languages, this function is named NewNanoId.

title: Core.nanoId
content: Core.nanoId nanoId Generates a new identifier with the default alphabet and size. When viewed from other languages, this function is named NewNanoId.

title: Alphabets
content:
Alphabets 

 Pre-defined alphabets commonly used to generation identities.
 
Alphabets.Alphanumeric 
Alphanumeric

title: Alphabets.Alphanumeric
content:
Alphabets.Alphanumeric 
Alphanumeric 

 from 0 to 9, not including any symbols or special characters.

title: Alphabets.HexadecimalLowercase
content:
Alphabets.HexadecimalLowercase 
HexadecimalLowercase 

 Hexadecimal lowercase characters: 0123456789abcdef.

title: Alphabets.HexadecimalUppercase
content:
Alphabets.HexadecimalUppercase 
HexadecimalUppercase 

 Hexadecimal uppercase characters: 0123456789ABCDEF.

title: Alphabets.Lowercase
content:
Alphabets.Lowercase 
Lowercase 

 Lowercase English letters: abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz.

title: Alphabets.NoLookalikes
content:
Alphabets.NoLookalikes 
NoLookalikes 

 Numbers, Uppercase, and Lowercase without "lookalikes":
 1, l, I, 0, O, o, u, v, 5, S, s, 2, Z.
 Complete set: 346789ABCDEFGHJKLMNPQRTUVWXYabcdefghijkmnpqrtwxyz.

title: Alphabets.NoLookalikesSafe
content:
Alphabets.NoLookalikesSafe 
NoLookalikesSafe 

 Same as Nolookalikes -- but having removed vowels and: 3, 4, x, X, V.
 Complete set: 6789BCDFGHJKLMNPQRTWbcdfghjkmnpqrtwz

title: Alphabets.Numbers
content:
Alphabets.Numbers 
Numbers 

 Numbers from 0 to 9.

title: Alphabets.Uppercase
content:
Alphabets.Uppercase 
Uppercase 

 Uppercase English letters: ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ.

title: Alphabets.UrlSafe
content: Alphabets.UrlSafe UrlSafe URL-friendly numbers, English letters, and symbols: A-Za-z0-9_-. This is the default alphabet if one is not explicitly specified.

title: Defaults
content:
Defaults 

 Defines the recommended set of characters and output length
 for optimally generating nano identifier strings.
 
Defaults.Alphabet 
Alphabet 
Defaults.Size 
Size

title: Defaults.Alphabet
content: Defaults.Alphabet Alphabet An alphabet consisting of: URL-friendly numbers, English letters, and symbols (ie: A-Za-z0-9_-). This is the default alphabet if one is not explicitly specified.

title: Defaults.Size
content:
Defaults.Size 
Size 

 Twenty-one (21) single-byte characters.
 This is the default output length if one is not explicitly specified.

title: Tagged
content: Tagged Contains primitives for generating identifiers which are "tagged" with a discriminator (useful for managing lots of string which have different purposes, but where using a full CLR type is undesirable). This module is not intended for languages other than F#. Tagged.nanoid nanoid Tagged.string<'Tag> string<'Tag> Tagged.nanoIdOf' nanoIdOf' Tagged.nanoId' nanoId'

title: Tagged.nanoIdOf'
content: Tagged.nanoIdOf' nanoIdOf' Generates a new tagged identifier, size characters in length, derived from the letters of the given alphabet (note: a size of less than one will result in an empty string). This function is not intended for languages other than F#.

title: Tagged.nanoId'
content: Tagged.nanoId' nanoId' Generates a new tagged identifier with the default alphabet and size. This function is not intended for languages other than F#.

title: nanoid
content: nanoid A "tag", which can be used as a discriminator. This tag is not intended for languages other than F#. nanoid.tag tag

title: nanoid.tag
content: nanoid.tag tag Applies the nanoid "tag" to a string. This function is not intended for languages other than F#.

title: string<'Tag>
content: string<'Tag> An abbreviation for the CLI type System.String. This alias is not intended for languages other than F#.

title: NanoId
content:
NanoId 

 Contains utilities for working with nano identifiers.

NanoId.ofDefaults 
ofDefaults 
NanoId.ofOptions

title: NanoId.length
content:
NanoId.length 
length 

 The number of characters in the given nanoId instance.

title: NanoId.isEmpty
content:
NanoId.isEmpty 
isEmpty 

 Returns true, when the given nanoId is zero-valued; otherwise, false.

title: NanoId.ofDefaults
content: NanoId.ofDefaults ofDefaults Creates a new instance using the default alphabet and size (nb: the default alphabet is URL-friendly numbers, English letters, and symbols: A-Za-z0-9_- and the default size is 21).

title: NanoId.ofOptions
content: NanoId.ofOptions ofOptions Creates a new NanoId instance of the given size whose letters are taken from the given alphabet.

title: NanoId.parseAs
content: NanoId.parseAs parseAs Attempts to convert the given value into a NanoId, using the given alphabet to guide validation.

title: Alphabet
content: Alphabet Represents a validated set of 'letters' from which an identifier is made (for details, see Alphabet.Validate). Alphabet.MakeNanoId MakeNanoId Alphabet.ParseNanoId ParseNanoId Alphabet.Letters Letters Alphabet.Validate Validate

title: Alphabet.MakeNanoId
content: Alphabet.MakeNanoId MakeNanoId Creates a new NanoId instance of the given size whose letters are taken from the current alphabet.

title: Alphabet.ParseNanoId
content: Alphabet.ParseNanoId ParseNanoId Attempts to convert the given value into a NanoId, using the current alphabet to guide validation.

title: Alphabet.Letters
content:
Alphabet.Letters 
Letters 

 The validated letter set in this instance.

title: Alphabet.Validate
content:
Alphabet.Validate Validate Builds a new Alphabet from the given letter set after checking that it upholds certain invariants which are necessary for the algorithm to work well. An alphabet's letters MUST uphold the following invariants:
  • Is not null
  • Contains at least one (1) non-whitespace letter
  • Contains no more then 255 letters

title: AlphabetError
content: AlphabetError Details the potential failures which can occur when an a letter set is validated during Alphabet creation. AlphabetError.Promote Promote AlphabetError.Message Message AlphabetError.Letters Letters AlphabetError.AlphabetTooLarge AlphabetTooLarge AlphabetError.AlphabetTooSmall AlphabetTooSmall

title: AlphabetError.Promote
content: AlphabetError.Promote Promote Creates an AlphabetException from the current AlphabetError instance. The newly created exception is then raised.

title: AlphabetError.Message
content:
AlphabetError.Message 
Message 

 A human-readable description of the error, suitable for printing.

title: AlphabetError.Letters
content:
AlphabetError.Letters 
Letters 

 The letter set which generated the current error.

title: AlphabetError.AlphabetTooLarge
content:
AlphabetError.AlphabetTooLarge 
AlphabetTooLarge 

 Raised when an alphabet contains more than 255 letters.

title: AlphabetError.AlphabetTooSmall
content:
AlphabetError.AlphabetTooSmall 
AlphabetTooSmall 

 Raised when an alphabet contains no letters.

title: AlphabetException
content:
AlphabetException 

 Encapsulates data for the point-in-time failure of
 an operation involving alphabet validation.
 
AlphabetException.Alphabet 
Alphabet 
AlphabetException.Reason 
Reason

title: AlphabetException.Alphabet
content:
AlphabetException.Alphabet 
Alphabet 

 The alphabet which lead to the exception.

title: AlphabetException.Reason
content:
AlphabetException.Reason 
Reason 

 Further details about the actual failure.

title: AlphabetExtensions
content: AlphabetExtensions Contains utilities intended to simplify working with Alphabet in languages other than F#. AlphabetExtensions.ToAlphabet ToAlphabet AlphabetExtensions.ToAlphabetOrThrow ToAlphabetOrThrow AlphabetExtensions.TryParseNanoId TryParseNanoId

title: AlphabetExtensions.ToAlphabet
content:
AlphabetExtensions.ToAlphabet ToAlphabet Builds a new Alphabet from the given letter set after checking that it upholds certain invariants which are necessary for the algorithm to work well. An alphabet's letters MUST uphold the following invariants:
  • Is not null
  • Contains at least one (1) non-whitespace letter
  • Contains no more then 255 letters

title: AlphabetExtensions.ToAlphabetOrThrow
content:
AlphabetExtensions.ToAlphabetOrThrow ToAlphabetOrThrow Builds a new Alphabet from the given letter set after checking that it upholds certain invariants which are necessary for the algorithm to work well. An alphabet's letters MUST uphold the following invariants:
  • Is not null
  • Contains at least one (1) non-whitespace letter
  • Contains no more then 255 letters

title: AlphabetExtensions.TryParseNanoId
content: AlphabetExtensions.TryParseNanoId TryParseNanoId Attempts to convert the given value into a NanoId, using the current alphabet to guide validation.

title: NanoId
content:
NanoId 

 Represents a unique textual identifier, with a known length,
 based on a particular alphabet (i.e. a set of letters).
 
NanoId.Length 
Length 
NanoId.NewId 
NewId 
NanoId.Empty 
Empty

title: NanoId.Length
content:
NanoId.Length 
Length 

 The number of characters in this instance.

title: NanoId.NewId
content: NanoId.NewId NewId Creates a new instance using the default alphabet and size (nb: the default alphabet is URL-friendly numbers, English letters, and symbols: A-Za-z0-9_- and the default size is 21).

title: NanoId.Empty
content:
NanoId.Empty 
Empty 

 The zero-valued instance of this type.

title: Install the Core Module from Source
content:
--- title: Install the Core Module from Source category: How-To Guides categoryindex: 1 index: 7 --- How-To: Install the Core Module from Source === Ananoid can serve most uses cases via the `cref:T:pblasucci.Ananoid.NanoId` type and its associates (`cref:T:pblasucci.Ananoid.Alphabet`, et cetera). However, sometimes this is not desired (or at least, not _optimal_). For times when the a struct or class is just too much, Ananoid also provides its core functionality -- cryptographically-secure randomly-generated identifiers -- as functions which take primitive inputs and just produce strings. Further, there are some circumstances wherein it might be advantageous to only take the lowest-level parts of the library as a _source-code dependency_ (the so-called "vendorizing" of dependencies). In order to accomodate this, the library has been carefully structured so that you may simply copy the file [`Core.fs`][1] into your project and treat these functions as just another module in your library/application/et cetera. > --- > ##Attention!!! > > __Unfortunately, this is only applicable for F# projects... sorry ¯\_(ツ)_/¯.__ > > ---
OUT
### Related Reading + [How-To: Work with Tagged NanoId strings][2] + [Performance: Select Highlights][3] ### Copyright The library is available under the Mozilla Public License, Version 2.0. For more information see the project's [License][0] file. [0]: https://github.com/pblasucci/ananoid/blob/main/LICENSE.txt [1]: https://github.com/pblasucci/ananoid/blob/main/ananoid/Core.fs [2]: ../guides/taggednanoid.html [3]: ../explanations/highlights.html
